fxInfo_label: HOG selection by legislature in practice
fxInfo_citation: V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: By ”approval” we mean both explicit approval, such as through a vote of confidence, and tacit approval, such as a practice stating that the head of government has to have majority support in the legislature although no vote is taken on his/her appointment.
fxInfo_notes: Converted from (B) to (A) coding. v2expathhg is coded according to appointment dates of the Head of Government. The same is true for coups or rebellions where the date when the HOG was appointed through a coup, or the first day in office after the coup, is coded.
fxInfo_ordering: Answer this question only if you selected 1-6 on question v2expathhg.
fxInfo_question: Was the approval of the legislature necessary for the appointment of the head of government?
